data.title: Academic and research staff
data.content:
Dr. Arthur Yu ZOU, Professor
Dr. Yu ZOU is a professor of Applied Linguistics, Communication University of China (CUC), director of the National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring & Research Center, a research institution jointly established by Ministry of Education and CUC; he is a research fellow of the State Key Laboratory of Media Convergence & Communication (MCC) at CUC. He is also a head of the Natural Language Processing Research Team at MCC.

Currently, his main research interests cover Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring and Research, Corpus Linguistics, and Media Discourse Analysis, etc.

More>>>
   

Dr. Nanchang CHENG, Associate Professor
Dr. Nanchang CHENG is an associate professor of National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring and Research Center at Communication University of China (CUC). He received a PhD in Computational Linguistics in July 2013 from CUC, was a postdoc 2013-2015 at Institute of Automation，Chinese Academy of Sciences, and was on the faculty of CUC since 2015.

Currently, his main research interests cover natural language processing and its application to the social media and the public opinion monitoring on web. He also has a course in Computational Linguistics for graduate student.
   

Dr. Shufeng LIU, Professor
Dr. Shufeng LIU was born in March 1978 in Jinan, Shandong Province. Professor of editor by the Academic Journal Center of Communication University of China, deputy editor in chief of China Radio and Television Yearbook. Research Fellow of National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring & Research Center. He is a Postgraduate Tutor of Communication University of China. He is mainly engaged in the research of Journalism and communication, Compilation and Publication of annals, Cultural industry, etc.

He has published more than 20 academic papers in domestic and foreign academic journals such as Communication and Society, Modern Communication and China Publishing. He is the sole author and co editor in chief of 3 academic works, and works as the deputy editor in chief of Beijing chronicles · Radio and Television Records (1994-2010). He has undertaken a number of research projects of the Ministry of education and relevant departments of Beijing Municipality, and participated in several major projects of National Social Science Fund. The paper has won the second prize of Fang Hanqi award of "journalism and Communication Society Award" of The Chinese Association for History of Journalism and Mass Communication, the second prize of "national Yearbook Academic Thesis Award" of Yearbook Working Committee of China Publishing Association, and the first prize of "commemorating the 80th anniversary of the birth of Chinese people's Broadcasting" by China Federation of Radio and Television Associations.
   

Dr. Hongdong LIU, Professor
Dr. Hongdong LIU is a professor of French Language Department of Shandong University. Supervisor for master students. Associate dean of the College of Foreign Languages of Shandong University. Member of the National Foreign Languages Advisory Board under the Ministry of Education. Director of the European Language and Culture Research Center. He is also a research fellow of the National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring & Research Center.

Mainly engaged in researches related to French Teaching Methodology, Language Policies and Language Planning, and Language and Culture Communication.
Presided over several projects supported by National Social Science Foundation, State Language Work Committee, Social & Science Foundation of Ministry of Education, and Shandong Social Science Foundation. Edited and coedited several sets of textbooks. Published 2 works and more than 20 theses and policy consultation reports.
   

Dr. Weiran ZHANG, Associate Professor
Weiran ZHANG obtained her PhD in Linguistics and Applied Linguistics from Peking University and in Chinese from Université de Paris Diderot-Paris 7. She is currently an associate professor at the Communication University of China, working both in the department of Linguistics and in National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring and Research Center. Her research interest includes Media Discourse Analysis, Language Policy, Lexicology, and International Chinese Language Education.
   

Dr. Sonia Qin SONG, Associate Professor
Sonia Qin SONG is an associate professor of Communication Studies at the State Key Laboratory of Media Convergence and Communication, and a research fellow of National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring & Research Center at Communication University of China. She tends to focus on international communication studies, media and digital culture research, public opinion monitoring and analysis, etc.

She has published a monograph Research on Western Post-Truth Issues in the Context of Social Media and translated Popular Music, Digital Technology and Society. She has published a number of academic papers in domestic and International journals, and a number of special reports have been adopted.

More>>>

data.title: About Us
data.content:
National Broadcast Media Language Resources Monitoring and Research Center, a joint institution of the Department of Language Information Management at the State Ministry of Education and Communication University of China (CUC), was established on September 16th, 2005. Relying on the subject characteristics and comprehensive advantages of mass media in China, the Center is based on theoretical research, and sets applied research as the emphasis and service the country as the goal, to carry out organized and open scientific research. The distinctive features of the Center lie in many aspects like accumulation of media language resources, development of language tools, application of language data, construction of language engineering, as well as in language monitoring achievements' services to the country and society.

The Center tries to explore language monitoring theories, and firstly puts forward language monitoring framework system and Temporal-Spatial Modeling of Vocabulary in Chinese. It has constructed Media Language Corpus (MLC), a dynamic circulating broadcast media language corpus with large scale and multi-mode, and Chinese Mandarin Digital Multi-modal Corpus (CMDMC). The Center has developed language information processing platform for language monitoring, including the automatic segmentation and tagging system CUCBst (including its stand-alone and online-free versions), speech and video retrieval system, automatic monitoring system of alphabetic words in Chinese, extraction system of new words and expressions, extraction system of popular words and phrases, the Chinese character/word frequency statistics tool RCRS & TCRS, etc. The Center has established a website which is based on China and faces the world - the Platform for Media Language Resources Service (http://ling.cuc.edu.cn), a sharing platform of media language resources, a service platform for Applied Linguistics research, and a communication platform for mandarin Chinese monitoring technologies. The Center has also built the National Public Opinion Database of Language, which has achievement the automatic monitoring of public opinions on Chinese language, and the monitoring achievements are submitted to Department of Language Information Management at the State Ministry of Education and its other centers for language resources monitoring and research, to be the data source of the internal reference Yuqing Xinxi (the Information about Public Opinions of Language).

Since the establishment, the Center has devoted to the investigation and research on broadcast media language, participated in the issue of the Year Book on Language Situation in China (i.e. Lvpishu) and the release of the Top 10s of Popular Words and Phrases in Media, taken on the research and release of the Top 10s of New Words and Expressions in Media, and edited and published the annual dictionary of Chinese New Words and Expressions (2007-2018). Since 2011, the center has been regularly publishing to the community of Top 10s of China’s Media Focus, which has caused great sensation and was real-time reported by Xinhuanet, People’s network, Guangming Daily, Beijing TV, and many other media. In Jan. 2016, the Center also co-published Chinese Enterprises’ International Communication Capacity with the National Center for Communication Innovation Studies at CUC.

This Center’s research team has taken on and finished about 20 national and provincial research programs supported from the National Social Science Fund, the State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television, the Department of Social Sciences and Department of Science and Technology at the State Ministry of Education, and the State Language Commission, etc. They have published more than 20 books, and 180 papers in the core journals and domestic and international conferences. Based on the view of building the center openly and jointing national powers to research, the Center has established partnerships to share resources and technologies with many research organizations and enterprises, including Institute of Computational Linguistics at Peking University, Department of Electronic Engineering at Tsinghua University, Institute of Information Science at Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing Language and Culture University, Institute of Linguistics at Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, Institute of Linguistics at Academia Sinica in Taiwan, and RSN Co., Ltd in Korea.
